metadata.name: Suspicious Curl File Upload - Linux
metadata.comment: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/curl')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --form')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --upload-file ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --data ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' --data-'))) AND process.cmd_line rlike '\\s-\[FTd\]\\s' AND NOT (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('://localhost')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('://127.0.0.1'))))

output.summary: Detects a suspicious curl process start the adds a file to a web request

metadata.objective: False positive: Scripts created by developers and admins References: https://twitter.com/d1r4c/status/1279042657508081664, https://medium.com/@petehouston/upload-files-with-curl-93064dcccc76, https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/f339e7da7d05f6057fdfcdd3742bfcf365fee2a9/atomics/T1105/T1105.md#atomic-test-19---curl-upload-file, https://curl.se/docs/manpage.html, https://www.trendmicro.com/en_us/research/22/i/how-malicious-actors-abuse-native-linux-tools-in-their-attacks.html
